page.title: 10St. Michael's - Shawforth
page.content: St. John with St. Michael School was opened in 1971 as a replacement school for St. Michael's (Shawforth) and St. John's (Facit). In 1971 there were 120 pupils on roll, but, in common with virtually all schools in England in 1985 numbers have fallen, to 76 at present, in spite of this being the only school in Shawforth. The open setting of the school, however, encourages local animals to regularly boost numbers on roll! Farmers' goats, cows, sheep, chickens, horses and ducks are part of the scene and are accepted by all. On Sundays the school is used as a church (St. Michael's Mission). Although Shawforth is in many ways steeped in the past, modern technology has infiltrated the school which owns a Teletext television, video recorder, BBC computer, printer & photo copier.
